text: Hungary at the Olympics is a history which began at the first Olympic Games in 1896. The International Olympic Committee's official abbreviation for Hungary is HUN. "Official abbreviations" at The Games of the XVIII Olympiad, Tokyo, 1964, [p. 9 of 409 PDF]; retrieved 2012-10-12. ==History== Teams from Hungary have been in most Summer Olympic Games and every Winter Olympic Games since then. The nation was not invited to the 1920 Games after World War I. Hungarian athletes have won a total of 475 medals, with fencing as the top medal-producing sport. Hungary has won more Olympic medals than any other nation that has never hosted Games. The National Olympic Committee for Hungary is the Hungarian Olympic Committee.
